intro: Gynoglottis palilabellatum, commonly known as the narrow-lipped gynoglottis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Commelinaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, white or pale blue flowers with prominent stamens. It is native to tropical regions of South America and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
